summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's office regarding a civilian tip about Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses a retired federal agent turned private investigator who has information on Epstein and a similar case involving a NYC businessman, and coordinates a meeting.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York relays initial information about a tip regarding someone with information relevant to the Epstein investigation and requests the FBI reach out.

events.title: Phone call with retired federal agent/PI
events.description: An FBI agent speaks with a retired federal agent now working as a private investigator who has information involving Jeffrey Epstein and a similar case involving a NYC-based businessman.

events.title: Coordination for meeting with tipster
events.description: FBI agents coordinate to schedule a meeting for August 15 or 16 with the retired federal agent/PI and a civil attorney who has been working on their end.

keyFacts: A retired federal agent, now working as a private investigator, contacted the FBI in August 2019 with information on Jeffrey Epstein.
The tipster also had information on a similar case involving a NYC-based businessman.
The tipster intended to bring a civil attorney who had been working on their end to a meeting with the FBI.
The initial tip was relayed to the FBI by an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The email chain shows active coordination within the FBI's New York office to schedule a meeting with the informant promptly.
